TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PropertyFilter extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides filtering functionality for a property editing host.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Contains a list of strings, called *predicates*, that are compared against a target property name until a match is found.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Activities.Presentation.PropertyEditing.PropertyFilterPredicate> predicates) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> list of predicates, or strings used for matching.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class that includes an enumeration of filtering strings, called *predicates*, that can be compared against a target property name until a match is found.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string filterText) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.String> that contains space-delimited predicates for property filtering.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class that includes a <xref:System.String> that contains a space-delimited sequence of filtering phrases, called *predicates*, that can be compared against a target property name until a match is found.
Read-only property that indicates whether this <xref:System.Activities.Design.PropertyEditing.PropertyFilter> does not have any filtering predicates.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Match(class System.Activities.Presentation.PropertyEditing.IPropertyFilterTarget target) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property that the current filter will be compared against when looking for a match.
Docs.summary: Matches the predicate strings of the current filtering object against the specified target property name and returns a Boolean that indicates whether one or more of the predicate strings matches the target name or whether this does not have any predicates.
